data.title: I'd Give It An "Incomplete"
data.text: My wife & I had Saturday evening reservations at Milano.  We arrived approx. 10 minutes early, and encountered what looked like a confused staff & a large number of patrons milling about just inside the restaurant door.  A gentleman that I assumed was the manager on duty finally greeted us; when I told him we had a reservation at 5:30 p.m., he said: "It will be at least a half hour before we can seat you.  You can sit over there & wait."  We sat for about 5 minutes in the small waiting area, watching the continuing confusion over handling what might've been an unexpected dinner crowd or maybe a short staff situation or both.  Then we got up & walked up the street to Backstage Bar & Grill, where the service was attentive & where the food suited our change of plans before the hockey game.  My "Average" rating for Milano's gives them the benefit of the doubt for that evening, but we won't be hurrying back to give them another chance to actually seat us & serve us a good meal.

data.title: Budget friendly
data.text: Went here with a group for lunch. They have a nice buffet. Pizza, calzones, pasta, and salad. They give you large quantities for around $8.00. The food is ok. The staff is really friendly.

data.title: Wonderful Food.......RUDE STAFF
data.text:
The food is amazing!! I go there for lunch every so often, the problem is when I go, the owner is often very rude and short. When I went this past week, I asked for onions and tomatoes from the salad bar because they were all gone among other toppings for your salad, realizing that there are only about 6 options to put on your salad because the bar isn't very large. So, two missing for toppings is quite a bit in this situation.  His reply was that it takes too much time  so I would have to wait 15 minutes!!! Seriously, for lunch? My whole combo food plate would probably be gone by then.

When you purchase your food there are trays to set your plates and drinks on. I put my two plates of food on my tray and he asked me to pick it back up because he needed it!!!!!

data.title: Pretty Good Experience
data.text:
Lat night I dined with my wife at Milano's Italian Cuisine for the first time. It is located on Main Street in downtown Evansville. They offered outdoor seating on the walkway. The seating area was not so nice. They needed to spruce this area up and make it more inviting. 

The evening was great weather for eating outside. Service was good but did not quite have everything operating smoothly. Nothing was done incorrectly it just could have been a little better. 

My wife chose the chicken parmigiana and I did the baked eggplant parmigiana dish. These came with and Italian salad and bread. The salad had way too much dressing on it but otherwise was a nice mixture. The bread was an Italian kind of braided bread with pesto and garlic and oil/butter. Wow was the bread just perfect!!! We loved it! I thought it looked like it was going to have too much flavor but it was just perfect! Our entrees were tasty but nothing that was really special. 

It was a good experience overall just not as good as I had hoped for. Maybe a better place for lunch than dinner.

data.title: Night out
data.text: Very impressed. Good prompt service. Food quality very good. Nice family atmosphere and very clean. Staff polite and professional.  First visit and we'll return in the future.

data.title: Surprisingly good
data.text: we had not been there for a couple years as the last time was just so-so. We went there for dinner last week. This visit we both had a shrimp dish and they were excellent. The atmosphere is nice -- quiet, a little formal but very pleasant. Good service.

data.title: Italian Cusine
data.text: We went to Milano's for an early Valentine dinner. There were many events going on in downtown Evansville that evening, so we made reservations. Although we arrived a few minutes early we were seated in a booth promptly. The decor is almost a "Shabby Chic". We had an excellent chianti. Both ordered veal dishes. One was great, the other was very sour, which the waiter removed from the bill and replaced by a spaghetti dish and offered a complimentary dessert. Service was prompt and helpful. Dinner prices would be considered moderate. It is worth a return visit. Parking can be a problem on a busy night.

data.title: Date night to hockey game
data.text: We had tickets for the Iceman Hockey game and wanted to try some place new for dinner. I had asked on Facebook about Milano's and had gotten a couple of good responses. We arrived shortly after they opened around 5 pm. They weren't very busy yet so we were seated immediately. The decor kinda dated and really didn't seem to go with the Italian theme. Service was slow to start but there was one 1 waiter on duty when we arrived...so we didn't mind. Our waiter was polite and took our orders. The house salad and garlic knot rolls were yummy. Both of our entrees were delicious...chicken parmesan and chicken tortellini in pesto sauce...we would recommend this establishment...just don't judge by the looks of the inside

data.title: Enjoyable Italian eating.
data.text: We eat lunch here quite often. Great buffet and always fresh and hot. Great Italian food. Have great take out pizza too.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: Was very surprised at how good the food was. It's hard to find good Italian food. Would recommend Milanos to anyone

data.title: Dated
data.text: We were looking for a quick meal and since we were the only customers, that was not a problem.  The rolls and salad came within minutes and were very good. The entre also came quickly and was very good. As we looked around, though, it was sad to see the worn carpet and dreary drapes. I sat there wondering how to get this place nominated for a makeover on the TV show! The server/host was very pleasant, but I couldn't help imagining that there is much of a future for Milano's if it doesn't get a facelift. As another review said, if it's dated and dirty in the public area, you wonder what it looks like in the kitchen.

data.title: Authentic Italian
data.text: The service was excellent. The portion sizes were great. My Wife and I both took some home. The atmosphere could use a bit of attention. Outdated and only one song played during our entire visit. I recommend they get a new cd with more Italian songs.

data.title: Amazing
data.text: The chicken ala vodka was to die for. Service was great, wine was tasty. Other party ordered the sausage and peppers dish, it was also very good. Highly recommend!!

data.title: If you are in a hurry
data.text: This restaurant had a cafeteria style selection kitchen with a white table cloth sitting area.  For pizza and calzones on  limited time this is the place to go.

data.title: Great atmosphere
data.text: One of the few restaurants that still honor reservations, I came here with a group of 10 to celebrate birthday. Everyone love their food, I ordered chicken alla vodka. Speed of meal was perfect and I believe our waiter is owners son...he was very attentive and on point. The wine flowed and we felt able to laugh and be a little loud...no one seemed to mind as everyone else was having great time too. Can't wait to visit again!!

data.title: Don't be put off by the front entrance
data.text:
Main Street has some nice old buildings, Milanos is in one of them. It's a shame that some time around the 60/70's someone "modernized" the front with what is now ugly aluminum framed plate glass windows.
Inside is old style, and a little Big room to be cozy. I've read some other reviews and wonder where these people sat? We were a party of 7 so were towards the back in a sort of side room that was open plan and just tables and chairs in the room.
The menu was good, as was the wine list. Some good basic wines at reasonable prices.
The scallops came recommended so I ordered these. They arrived in a nice light cream sauce, perfectly cooked, firm and tender. Others had varying dishes with no complaints. My only complaint would probably the bread served with dinner, just a little too oily, but tasty non the less.
Certainly good Classic Italian cuisine. Just close your eyes as you go through the ugly frontage. Pity they could move to the beautiful wrought iron cascaded building half a block away, that would be a killer venue for this food.

data.title: WONDERFUL Food in Downtown Evansville!!!!!!!!!
data.text: Milano's is an Italian restaurant on the main street walk way. Now, i have to admit, this restaurant is a little near and dear to my heart because that is the first place i met my husband. We continue to make sure we visit at least once every six weeks or so, and go back every year and visit for our anniversary. Milano him self is such a joy to be around. So happy and positive. He is always working!!! I absolutely love the Carbonara!! It has to be the best carbonara i have ever eaten!!! The garlic knots are delish, and you have to be careful because you can eat 3 or 4 before you even realized it!! They have great salads, and the house Italian dressing is divine!!! My husband gets the lasagna, or the stuffed pizza. The lasagna is good, the stuffed pizza is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!! It is so delicious!!! If you have not been, you need to go...RIGHT....NOW!!!

data.title: Really good food
data.text: Have been here several times, very good lunch. Easy access and affordable pricing.  If you try a place on reviews then you should atleast try this one.

data.title: Awesome food, great atmosphere
data.text: Milano's has the best Italian food in Evansville. The prices are extremely reasonable. I love the quiet atmosphere and the service couldn't be any better. It's a thumbs up for us!!

data.title: authentic Italian at a great price
data.text: Milano's is my favorite restaurant in Evansville.  The service is always personal and excellent, and their food is consistently superb.  I travel regularly, including abroad, and Milano's remains one of my favorite places to eat.  The prices are great, and they have a nice selection of wines as well. I've eaten at Milano's numerous times over the past 6 years, and have never been disappointed.
